notes.note:
Bootstrap 4 is the newest version of Bootstrap; with new components, faster stylesheet and more responsiveness.

Bootstrap 4 supports the latest, stable releases of all major browsers and platforms. However, Internet Explorer 9 and down is not supported.

notes.title: constructor
notes.snippet: constructor(props) {   super(props);   this.state = {     list: props.initialList   }; }  // where props aren't used in constructor  constructor() {   super();   this.state = {     list: []   }; }
notes.note: it's awesome.

notes.title: componentDidMount
notes.note:
good for AJAX: fetch, ajax, or subscriptions.

   invoked once (client-side only). fires before initial 'render'

notes.title: componentWillReceiveProps
componentWillUpdatess
notes.note:
invoked immediately before update (new props or state).
   does not fire before initial 'render'.

 (see componentWillReceiveProps if you need to call setState)

notes.title: for loop
notes.snippet:
for (var i = 0; i < 10; i++) { document.write(i + ": " + i*3 + "
"); }
notes.note: Loops in JavaScript are used to execute the same block of code a specified number of times or while a specified condition is true. Very often when you write code, you want the same block of code to run over and over again in a row.

notes.title: Data types
notes.snippet: 1. var age = 18;                          2. var name = "Jane";                      3. var name = {first:"Jane", last:"Doe"};   4.var truth = false;                    5. var sheets = ["HTML","CSS","JS"];      6. var a; typeof a;                        7.var a = null;
notes.note: 1. returns number 2. returns string . 3. returns an object . 4. returns boolean . 5. returns an array .  6. returns undefined . 7. returns null.

notes.title: bootstrap install
notes.note: make sure you are in the root directory.

notes.title: Bootstrap CDN
notes.note: Skip the download with BootstrapCDN to deliver cached version of Bootstrap’s compiled CSS and JS to your project.

notes.title: bootstrap css
notes.note: Copy-paste the stylesheet <link> into your <head> before all other stylesheets to load our CSS.

notes.title: box sizing
notes.note: With the above snippet, nested elements—including generated content via ::before and ::after—will all inherit the specified box-sizing for that .selector-for-some-widget.

notes.title: semantic UI in HTML
notes.note: Running the gulp build tools will compile CSS and Javascript for use in your project. Just link to these files in your HTML along with the latest jQuery.

notes.title: blank html
notes.snippet: <!DOCTYPE html> <html lang="en">   <head>     <meta charset="utf-8">     <title>Page Title</title>     <meta name="description" content="Roughly 155 characters">     <link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="mystyle.css">     <script src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/1.7.1/jquery.min.js"></script>     <script src="script.js"></script>   </head>   <body>     <!-- Content -->   </body> </html>

notes.title: arrays
notes.note: JavaScript arrays are used to store multiple values in a single variable.

notes.title: functions
notes.snippet: function myFunction(p1, p2) {   return p1 * p2;   }
notes.note:
A JavaScript function is a block of code designed to perform a particular task.

A JavaScript function is executed when "something" invokes it (calls it)
